item.title: Destiny 2 Confirms Upcoming Reveal Event for The Edge of Fate
item.description:
Summary

  • Bungie teases The Edge of Fate for Destiny 2 alongside a livestream event.
  • The former Codename Apollo expansion now appears to be officially known as The Edge of Fate.
  • Interested players can get a glimpse at what's next for Destiny 2 on May 6.

Bungie finally gives Destiny 2 players a glimpse at what's coming over the next year, revealing a special livestream event to reveal The Edge of Fate. With Marathon taking the spotlight, there has been a bit of uncertainty for Destiny 2 players following the end of the Episode Heresy story and still no concrete information on what's coming next.

Following the launch of The Final Shape last year, Bungie announced changes to how it planned to deliver content, switching from Seasons to Episodes, while also announcing the future of Destiny 2 as Codename: Frontiers. Fans have been eager to know specifics regarding what's next for Destiny 2 as the episodic content has now come to a close and, outside the upcoming Rites of the Nine activity, the schedule has remained a bit mysterious. Thankfully, all of that is about to change starting in May.

While Bungie revealed bits and pieces of Codename: Frontiers over the past few months, Destiny 2 fans are finally getting a major look at the future of the game. In a new social media post, Bungie confirmed that on May 6, 2025, the studio is holding a special livestream to reveal what's coming to Destiny 2 over the next year. Based on the announcement, it also appears that the next expansion will be going by the name of The Edge of Fate.

Destiny 2: The Edge of Fate Livestream Reveal Date

  • May 6, 2025

Unfortunately, there were no other details or information shared about the upcoming reveal, though perhaps Bungie is saving that for the weekly blog post published on Thursday. Either way, it appears that the former Codename Apollo expansion is now officially known as The Edge of Fate. Based on Bungie's previous Destiny 2 roadmap tease, the expansion will be launching sometime this summer with two major updates and reward passes included during its lifecycle.

Speculation continues to revolve around the idea that the Destiny series could be leaving the current Solar System it has called home for over 10 years between both games. Rumors have attempted to fill in the information gaps a bit, indicating Destiny 2's upcoming expansions would be smaller in scope with highly replayable activities, though the small details that have come out seem to tease new story adventures. In fact, Destiny 2 's Assistant Game Director, Robbie Stevens, previously indicated that Bungie wants to get back to "expanding our worlds and world-building, expanding the universe of Destiny in general." With a comment like that, fans have speculated that upcoming expansions could finally be taking players to new areas, such as the old Eliksni homeworld of Riis.

item.title: Niantic Hit with Layoffs
item.description:
Summary

  • Niantic is laying off employees following its sale to Scopely.
  • At least 68 Niantic employees will be let go effective May 20, aimed at making the company more focused.
  • These layoffs follow similar ones that hit Pokemon GO support studio Very Very Spaceship.

Niantic is laying off employees shortly after its highly publicized sale to Scopely. The Pokemon GO publisher announced that it would be selling its video game business to the Saudi Arabia-owned Scopely for about $3.5 billion in March, with the deal itself being part of Saudi Arabia’s growing interest in the gaming industry. This buyout would affect the development teams of other Niantic games, but Pokemon GO was the one fans were most focused on due to its overall popularity.

When the buyout was announced, Pokemon GO lead Ed Wu assured worried gamers that Scopely wishes to prioritize making the best possible gaming experience, and that it would be a net positive for Niantic in the long run. For example, Pokemon GO senior product director Michael Steranka stated that Scopley will not sell user data or insert intrusive advertisements. However, Niantic did note that there would be layoffs as part of the resulting restructuring, as tends to be the case whenever one video game-related company purchases a smaller one.

The exact number of Niantic employees being let go has now been revealed in a Worker Adjustment and Retraining Notification that was published in California (via Game Developer). According to this report, Niantic will be laying off at least 68 workers effective May 20. These cuts were announced on March 20 in an internal email from Niantic CEO John Hanke, not too long after the sale to Scopely was first made public.

Niantic To Lay Off 68 Employees In May

During the earlier announcement of these layoffs, Hanke stated that these cuts would make the newly-formed Niantic Spatial Inc. more focused by effectively operating as a "startup organization," and that a lot of consideration was put into which roles to let go. He also said that these decisions were not made lightly and do not reflect the quality of work from the soon-to-be laid-off Niantic employees. Niantic has confirmed that Hanke’s notes are connected to the new WARN report, but it has no further comment at this time.

This isn’t the first time that a company behind Pokemon GO has been hit with layoffs, as the Seattle-based Pokemon GO support studio Very Very Spaceship cut numerous employees last May. This included producers, recruiters and HR staff, and artists for in-game model assets, some of whom were a part of the company for about three to five years before the layoff announcement. Only time will tell how this latest round of Niantic layoffs will impact games like Pokemon GO , though Niantic recently assured fans that it will not be shutting down under Scopely’s new leadership.

item.title: Fortnite: How to Get the Elite Zadie Skin for Free
item.description:
The original Zadie skin was released back in 2020, and it was a hit among fans almost immediately, quickly becoming one of the most commonly spotted skins in Fortnite at the time. Later on, Epic Games released a reskin of Zadie as part of the Agency Renegage Pack. This variant was called Shady Zadie and a pearlescent variant of Zadie with blue and white styles.

For years, these were the only two available Zadie skins in Fortnite , but the number doubled this month with the release of Vanguard Zadie and Elite Zadie. While players can get the Vanguard Zadie by completing quests, they have to go further and beyond to acquire Elite Zadie - here's how it works.

How to Get Elite Zadie in Fortnite

The Vanguard Zadie skin can be obtained simply by earning account levels, so it's within reach for everyone who plays Fortnite regularly. Elite Zadie, on the other hand, isn't as easily accessible - at least for now.

To get Elite Zadie in Fortnite , players must enter the Elite Zadie Reload Cups taking place on April 26 and 27. She will most likely be given away for free to players who secure a spot among the top players in their region . The rulers are not yet available, but we will update this article once more information is revealed. Nevertheless, players should make sure they keep an eye on the Compete tab.

Will Elite Zadie Be Available At a Later Time?

Fortnite cosmetics are no longer exclusive and can become available in the Item Shop at a later date. This means that Elite Zadie is not exclusive to players who obtain her in the tournament.

On top of this, in the blog post that mentions this giveaway, Epic Games notes that gamers will have additional opportunities to obtain Elite Zadie in May ; however, it is unknown if this means she will be available as part of another event or sold in the Item Shop.

item.title: Baldur's Gate 3: What is The Turning Point For [Redacted]?
item.description:
Baldur’s Gate 3 is no stranger to morally ambiguous characters, but none unsettle the player quite like the Emperor. At first, he appears as a mysterious benefactor — a figure in the Weave who offers guidance and protection from the dangers of the tadpole. Players may even find comfort in his presence, especially if they pursue a romance or lean on him for help during critical battles. But the illusion of benevolence begins to crack as Baldur’s Gate 3 heads into its final act, revealing layers of manipulation and control that redefine who, and what, the Emperor truly is.

His turning point is deliberately obscured, hidden beneath the choices players make and the level of trust they extend to him. Some may begin to question him during the dream sequences, while others only feel the weight of betrayal when they uncover his real identity or witness his willingness to turn them into a thrall. There is no single canon moment where the Emperor shows his true colors; rather, the game rewards players who dig into his past and motivations with the revelation that their so-called ally may be the biggest threat of all.

Baldur's Gate 3 Reveals Emperor’s Deceptions Gradually

The Emperor’s manipulation is most apparent in the contrast between his words and his actions. He constantly insists that he wishes to help the player be free of the tadpole, yet in reality, he pushes them toward deeper entanglement. When the time comes to make decisions about Orpheus, the githyanki prince, the Emperor advocates for absorbing Orpheus's power — a move that dooms the githyanki and binds the player even more tightly to the Mind Flayer’s influence.

This duplicity becomes even clearer if the player investigates his memories. One sequence in particular stands out: the memory of Duke Stelmane, a political leader he once manipulated and used for his own ends. By showcasing how he twisted her into a puppet to further his control, the game offers a stark warning of what he is capable of doing to the player. The message is subtle but unmistakable: the Emperor does not protect unless it serves his purpose.

These moments are not isolated. Whether it’s the disguised truth about the Dream Visitor, or the way the Emperor tries to guilt-trip the player for questioning him, Baldur’s Gate 3 slowly paints the picture of a being who sees others as tools. Those who resist his plans are treated as obstacles, not allies.

Baldur's Gate 3 Shifts Morality in Act 3

By Act 3, the Emperor’s façade is difficult to maintain. If the player chooses to align with Orpheus instead of submitting to the Emperor’s plan, the reaction is swift and brutal. He immediately brands the player a traitor, willing to turn against them and throw aside everything they’ve done together. What’s more, he appears to side with the Netherbrain, the same force he once vowed to help defeat, revealing how flexible his alliances truly are.

This moment is where many players identify the Emperor’s true turning point. It’s not just betrayal in narrative terms; it’s the culmination of a slow moral decay that’s been hinted at from the beginning. Whether or not the player views him as a villain depends on the path they’ve taken, but his willingness to sacrifice Orpheus, doom the githyanki, or enslave the player speaks volumes.

Romantic players might also feel this betrayal more keenly. The dream sequences create an illusion of intimacy, and many invest emotionally in the Dream Visitor only to discover they’ve been falling for a disguise. For those who custom-designed their Dream Visitor, the moment they realize it was the Emperor all along can feel especially personal, a manipulation not just of Tav, but of the player themselves.

Baldur's Gate 3 Links Emperor To Balduran

One of Baldur’s Gate 3 ’s most surprising late-game revelations comes from Ansur, who reveals that the Emperor is in fact Balduran, the legendary founder of the city itself. This twist recontextualizes the Emperor’s entire arc, connecting his hunger for control to a deep legacy. As Balduran, he was once a hero, now, as a Mind Flayer, he walks a blurred line between protector and tyrant.

This revelation also adds a thematic layer to Baldur’s Gate 3 ’s core story. The city of Baldur’s Gate becomes both a symbol of freedom and the site of control. Balduran’s transformation from founder to manipulator mirrors the corruption of power, and his desire to dominate the Netherbrain parallels the very oppression the game’s heroes seek to destroy.

His downfall, or continued influence, lies in the player’s hands. Choosing to side with him may lead to victory over the Netherbrain, but at what cost? Choosing to free Orpheus demands sacrifice, but also resists the Emperor’s dystopian vision of unity through control. It’s a choice that defines the end of the game, and cements the Emperor as one of its most compelling and divisive figures.

item.title: Destiny 2 Weekly Reset: New Nightfall, Challenges, and Rewards
item.description:
Updated April 15, 2025: Another week has come for Destiny 2 , which means missions, challenges, and rewards have been reset. In general Bungie news, Marathon finally had its long-awaited moment in the sun, revealing a release date and showcasing a bunch of gameplay after a lengthy development cycle. Reaction to the reveal has largely been mixed, especially after Bungie confirmed that Marathon wouldn't be free-to-play.

With Marathon getting the bulk of the spotlight over the past few days, fans have begun to wonder when Destiny 2 will be featured, especially with Codename Frontiers expected to launch sometime in the summer. Thankfully, fans won't have to wait long as Bungie confirmed a new livestream is coming on May 6 revealing The Edge of Fate and what's next for Destiny 2 .

For now, though, the Destiny 2 weekly reset has once again arrived, bringing with it the usual refreshed content, activities, and rewards for players to chase over the next week. For a complete look at all the new content available for the week of April 15, including Nightfalls, Crucible modes, and challenges, here is everything players need to know.

Weekly Nightfall and Modifiers

Nightfall Strike : PsiOps Battleground: Moon

Advanced Modifiers:

  • Champions : Unstoppable and Barrier
  • Hero Modifiers: Extra Shields. Solar, Void, and Arc.
  • Galvanized : Combatants have more health and are more difficult to stun.
  • Overcharge : Machine Gun and Kinetic Weapons when the player's subclass matches an active Surge element.
  • Threat : Solar
  • Surge : Arc and Void
  • Martyr : Exploder units have more health.

Expert Modifiers:

  • All previous modifiers.
  • Equipment Locked : Unable to change equipment once the mission starts.
  • Randomized Banes : Combatants are granted random Banes.
  • Expert Modifiers : Extra Shields

Master Modifiers:

  • All previous modifiers.
  • Togetherness : Base health regen is reduced. If near another player, health regen is increased.
  • Master Modifiers : Locked Loadout, Extra Champions, and Extra Shields.

Grandmaster Modifiers:

  • All previous modifiers.
  • Fire Pit : When defeated, Acolytes spawn fire pools that cause damage over time.
  • Chaff : Radar is disabled.
  • Grandmaster Modifiers : Extinguish, Limited Revives, Contest, Join In Progress Disabled, Extra Champions, Locked Loadout, Extra Shields

_______________________________________________________________

  • Nightfall Weapon : Shadow Price (Legendary Auto Rifle)

Episode: Heresy Challenges

  • Abilities Slayer - Defeat 200 combatants with abilities in the Court of Blades. Earn bonus progress for purchasing boons during the activity.
  • Mod Collector - Unlock 12 artifact mods.
  • Gotta Win Them All - Complete 30 activities in Vanguard, Gambit, or Crucible playlists. Bonus progress for completing Vanguard playlist activities at Advanced difficulty or higher, or for winning Gambit/Crucible matches.
  • Kinetic Forces - Get 150 final blows with Kinetic weapons. Bonus progress for defeating Guardians.

Exotic Mission Rotation

Bungie brought back various exotic missions for players to run through to earn new rewards, gear, as well as craftable versions of exotic weapons. Like the Raid and Dungeon rotator, this one changes on a weekly basis.

Featured Exotic Mission : Vox Obscura (Dead Messenger Exotic Grenade Launcher)

Raid and Dungeon Rotation

Originally introduced during Season 17, Bungie features Raids and Dungeons in a weekly rotation to make them farmable with updated rewards. Bungie is making 2 of each available in the featured rotation each week:

  • Featured Raid : Deep Stone Crypt and Root of Nightmares
  • Featured Dungeon : Ghosts of the Deep and Pit of Heresy

Raid Challenges

  • Salvation's Edge : Balanced Diet
  • Deep Stone Crypt : Copies of Copies, Red Rover, Of All Trades, The Core Four
  • Vow of the Disciple : Swift Destruction
  • Vault of Glass : Wait For It...
  • King's Fall : Hands Off
  • Root of Nightmares : Cosmic Equilibrium, Crossfire, All Hands, Illuminated Torment
  • Garden of Salvation : Leftovers
  • Last Wish : Strength of Memories

Ritual Activities: Crucible and Gambit

Players can earn additional rewards through Destiny 2 's Pathfinder system simply by playing and performing certain tasks in ritual activities like Vanguard Strikes, Crucible, and Gambit.

Legacy Activities and Challenges

Europa

  • Exo Challenge : Simulation: Safeguard
  • Eclipsed Zone : Cadmus Ridge
  • Empire Hunt : Praksis, The Technocrat

Neomuna

  • Incursion Zone : Liming Harbor
  • Campaign Mission : Downfall
  • Partition: Hard Reset

Throne World

  • Weekly Story Mission : The Communion
  • Altars of Reflection : Weekly activity that players can take on through specifically marked icons within the Throne World. These missions typically involve light puzzle solving as well as battling enemy combatants.

The Moon

  • Trove Guardian : Hellmouth
  • Wandering Nightmare: Nightmare of Horkis, Fear of Mithrax (Anchor of Light)
  • Campaign : In The Deep

Nightmare Rotation:

  • Phogoth (Fear)
  • Skolas (Pride)
  • Taniks (Isolation)
  • Ghaul (Rage)

Dreaming City

  • The Dreaming City Curse Level : High - The Dark Monastery
  • Petra Venj Location : Rheasilvia
  • The Blind Well : Taken enemies - Plague: Inomina
  • Ascendant Challenge : Keep of Honed Edges (Harbinger's Seclude)

Dares of Eternity Rotation

  • Round 1 : Hive
  • Round 2 : Vex
  • Final Round : Valus Ta'aurc

Xur Details

Xur, the exotic merchant of Destiny 2 , arrives every weekend until reset, giving players a short window to check out what he has in stock. With The Final Shape, Xur has seen a rework of what is on offer. Here's what the merchant has for the weekend of 4/11:

  • Nezarec's Sin (Warlock helmet)
  • Graviton Forfeit (Hunter helmet)
  • Phoenix Cradle (Titan leg armor)
  • Sweet Business (Auto Rifle)
  • Graviton Lance (Pulse Rifle)
  • The Queenbreaker (Heavy Linear Fusion Rifle)
  • Hawkmoon (Hand Cannon)
  • Tractor Cannon Catalyst
  • Borealis Catalyst
  • Sleeper Simulant Catalyst
  • The Xurfboard (Skimmer Board Vehicle)
  • Essentialism/Stoicism/Solipsism OR Exotic Cipher
  • Exotic Engram
  • Ascendant Shard
  • Glimmer
  • Enhancement Core
  • Upgrade Module
  • Strange Gift (Random Item for 1 Strange Coin)
  • Extraordinary Rendition (Kinetic Submachine Gun)
  • A Distant Pull (Kinetic Sniper Rifle)
  • Pleiades Corrector (Energy Scout Rifle)
  • The Eremite (Energy Fusion Rifle)
  • Hoosegow (Heavy Rocket Launcher)
  • Canis Major (Heavy Grenade Launcher)
  • Crown-Splitter/Quickfang/Eternity's Edge (Heavy Sword)
  • Strange Weapon Engram
  • Righteous Armor Set

Make sure to check back every Friday for a comprehensive breakdown of all the new exotic gear and rolls that Xur brings to Destiny 2 .

Trials of Osiris Map and Weekly Adept Weapon

Saint-14 and the Trails of Osiris offer players a high-end PvP activity in exchange for powerful rewards. Starting with Episode Heresy, Bungie made getting to the Lighthouse easier, while still offering top-tier rewards for those who can achieve a winning streak. Similar to most vendors in Destiny 2 , Saint-14 has a reputation system that rewards players for ranking up through playing and completing bounties.

Trials of Osiris for 4/11:

  • Map : Eventide Labs
  • Weapon : Exalted Truth (Legendary Adept Hand Cannon)
